title.text: Towards a Contextual Pragmatic Model to Detect Irony in Tweets

abstractContent.text: This paper proposes an approach to capture the pragmatic context needed to infer irony in tweets.

We aim to test the validity of two main hypotheses: (1) the presence of negations, as an internal propriety of an utterance, can help to detect the disparity between the literal and the intended meaning of an utterance, (2) a tweet containing an asserted fact of the form N ot(P 1) is ironic if and only if one can assess the absurdity of P 1.
Our first results are encouraging and show that deriving a pragmatic contextual model is feasible.
